questions.question_text:
A network administrator must install a device that will proactively stop outside attacks from reaching the LAN.
Which of the following devices would BEST meet the organization's needs?

discussion.content:
IPS - intrusion prevention system
IDS - intrusion detection system

Selected Answer: A
A IPS can detect and prevent identified threats in real time actively stopping malicious traffic from entering the network

questions.question_text: Users all over campus are calling the help desk to report issues connecting to the Internet. The help desk follows a script to ask questions about their issues. All the users answer the questions similarly. A help desk technician confirms no environmental changes have taken place and is currently looking through multiple system and application logs. Which of the following steps in the troubleshooting methodology is the technician currently performing?

choices.D: Establishing a plan of action to resolve the issue
choices.A: Testing the theory to determine cause

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Identifying the problem. The technician is gathering information about the problem from multiple sources, including user reports and system/application logs. This step involves identifying the symptoms of the problem, which in this case is the inability to connect to the Internet reported by users. Once the problem is identified, the technician can move on to the next step, which is to establish a plan of action to resolve the issue.
i think B is right

Selected Answer: B
B. Thin Clients is the correct answer because thin clients are computing devices that rely on a central server for processing and storage. Thin clients do not have any moving parts, such as a hard drive or fan, and are typically smaller and less expensive than traditional desktop computers or laptops. Because they are simpler and have fewer components, they are less likely to be damaged by spills or other accidents. In addition, because all the devices need to have an identical build, thin clients are an ideal option because they can be easily managed and updated centrally.

Selected Answer: B
Thin Clients

Selected Answer: B
I'am going to say Thin Client. Because a thin client is a lot cheaper with way less moving parts, probably easier to replace.

questions.question_text: A systems administrator at a school is setting up computing devices with keyboards. All the devices need to have an identical build. The administrator knows from prior experience that students often spill food or drinks on their devices. Which of the following is the BEST option for the administrator to use?
Which of the following devices can be used to connect multiple devices within a network without broadcasting to every network port?

discussion.content: Doesn't a hub broadcast to every port?

comments.content: a hub pushes to every port

discussion.content: ANSWER IS A

Selected Answer: A
The answer is A 
an unmanaged switch can be used to connect multiple devices within a network without broadcasting to every network port. 
unlike HUB which send data to all ports an unmanaged switch sends data only to the specific device it is intended for reducing unnecessary network traffic.

Selected Answer: A
Its Switch
Correct answer is A. Switch either managed or not will not broadcast to every port.
If i answer “hub” on the exam, would it count as a correct answer?
The correct answer is A Not B

Selected Answer: A
It is A
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

Selected Answer: A
ANSWER IS A

Selected Answer: A
No Idea why they think the answer is B. it is absolutely A
The answer is A. Hub performs broadcast.It is a non intelligent network device that sends message to all ports.
I think examtopics should respond to this particular question, let us know why they chose "Hub"

Selected Answer: A
Hub can broadcasting to every network port

This answer, as provided, is absolutely incorrect. In fact, it's the opposite of correct. If you are taking your knowledge from this site, you will likely not pass your exam. Yes, I know, this comment won't see the light of day. Examtopics, why are you trying to cause people to fail their expensive certification exams?

comments.content:
Saying the answer is incorrect, and the opposite of correct, is saying the same thing twice.
Your second statement is false. I passed the exam on my first try using these questions. People need to research and understand why the answer is correct, or incorrect, is all.
Lastly, examtopics is not intentionally causing people to fail. It is all on the user, whether they take everything at face value or not.

discussion.content: Hub broadcast to every port..The answer is A
Answer is A:
A: Unmanaged Switch.

For those curious about the difference between manage and unmanaged switch: Unlike unmanaged switch, manage switch have a built-in web page that you can access to do custom configuration. As a result managed switches allow more complex features.
I think the answer is A....

A network hub is a device that allows multiple computers to communicate with each other over a network. ... Hubs are similar to switches, but are not as "smart." While switches send incoming data to a specific port, hubs broadcast all incoming data to all active ports.Jun 27, 2015

https://www.google.com/search?q=does+hub+broadcast+everywhere&sxsrf=ALeKk027UH9hqDQc9zodTyZ4jcwEHcJlYA%3A1620632104741&ei=KOKYYIrZLMP6-Qarw6SgCw&oq=does+hub+broadcast+everywhere&gs_lcp=Cgdnd3Mtd2l6EAM6BwgAEEcQsANQ9R9YnCxgky5oAnACeACAAYUBiAHFBpIBAzAuN5gBAKABAaoBB2d3cy13aXrIAQjAAQE&sclient=gws-wiz&ved=0ahUKEwiKjaiHzb7wAhVDfd4KHashCbQQ4dUDCA4&uact=5

questions.question_text: A technician logs on to a PC and inserts an encrypted USB drive. When opening File Explorer, the technician cannot see the USB drive. Which of the following tools should the technician use to see all drives?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B. Disk Management.

Disk Management is a Windows utility that allows a technician to view all connected storage devices, including USB drives. From there, the technician can initialize, partition, and format the drive as necessary.
Answer is A
it is A. "diskpart"

Selected Answer: B
Disk managment to see all drives
Not disk management?
